TopicTitle: What's the Optimal Aerobreaking Altitude on Jool

Articles.Content:
Running a mission, and realized I didn't know..

So.
Where are you trying to get to? For Laythe, I tend to aerobrake at about 118km.

I'm sending a large probe ship to the system. I'm planning on landing on all of the moons except Tylo.

118 sounds good. Laythe is going to be the focus of the expedition. I might send a manned lander there next.

There is no 'optimal aerobreaking' seeing as it depends entirely on what speed you're coming in at and what final apoapsis you want.

Try this: http://alterbaron.github.io/ksp_aerocalc/

I've found that if I attempt to aerobrake on Jool at an altitude lower than 190km, Jool completely sucks in my ship with no hope of escape, so I recommend aerobraking at 195km several times until you reach your desired apoapsis height
